definitions.text: insulting terms of address for people who are stupid or irritating or ridiculous
a depression scratched or carved into a surface
the act of puncturing with a small point
examples: he gave the balloon a small prick

definitions.text: make a small hole into, as with a needle or a thorn
examples: The nurse pricked my finger to get a small blood sample
The dog pricked up his ears

definitions.text: stab or urge on as if with a pointed stick
to cause a sharp emotional pain
examples: The thought of her unhappiness pricked his conscience
A bee stung my arm yesterday
